noteR.para: To avoid residual air being present in the brake circuit, the parking brake must be released before starting the bleeding process.

noteR.para: Switch off the vehicle ignition so as not to activate the hydraulic unit solenoid valves when bleeding the brake circuit.
The level should be between the "MINI" and "MAXI" marks on the tank.

para.b: To avoid creating a fault in the brake system and causing a warning light to appear on the dashboard, begin bleeding using the brake pedal.
So as not to compromise the brake calliper sealing, bring the brake pistons, pads and discs into contact by operating the parking brake lever several times.

noteR.para: Remove thepedal pressbefore carrying out the braking system bleeding procedure.

procstep.para: Position the vehicle on a two-post liftvehicle: towing and liftingGIEMR-002447.
Switch off the vehicle ignition.
Connect thebrake circuit bleeding device(having received Renault approval) to the master cylinder reservoir (see the instructions for the equipment).
Pressurise the brake circuit.
Adjust the pressure to between 1.5 bar < P < 2 bar for 3 minutes to stabilise it in the braking circuit.
Close the circuit between the bleed screw and brake fluid reservoir without dumping the pressure.

noteR.para: The circuit between the bleed screw and brake fluid reservoir is closed in different ways depending on the type of equipment used:

procstep.para: Fit the bleed containers to the six bleed screws of the brake callipers.

noteR.para: Some callipers are equipped with several bleed screws. In this case, turn the bolts one after another to perform the brake circuit bleed.

procstep.para: Loosen the bleed screws on the brake callipers in the following order:
Open the circuit between the bleed screw and brake fluid reservoir and allow the liquid to run until all the air bubbles have been released.
Tighten the bleed screws on the brake callipers in the following order:
Loosen the bleed screw on the brake calliper.
Let the fluid run until all air bubbles have been released.
Tighten the bleed screw on the brake calliper.
Repeat the previous operation on the following brake callipers:
Stop thebrake circuit bleeding device to decrease the pressure in the brake circuit.
Remove thebrake circuit bleeding devicefrom the brake fluid reservoir.

noteR.para: Do not enter / exit the vehicle when it is raised.

procstep.para: Exit the vehicle when it is fully lowered.

Check the brake pedal travel and resistance. If, and only if, they are not OK, finish bleeding the brake circuit with the help of a second operator. A workshop manager must approve and supervise the operation.
The first operator sits in the driver's position and buckles his seat belt.
The second operator raises the lift to a height of 80 cm. This height MUST NOT be exceeded

The first operator may now exit the vehicle.
Top up the brake fluid level in the reservoir, if necessary. Check the sealing of the front and rear bleed screws and ensure that the sealing covers are in place:

procstep.para: Top up the brake fluid level in the reservoir if necessary. Check the tightness of the bleed screws(11 N.m)and the presence of the sealing covers.
Clean off any traces of brake fluid on the vehicle using Brake cleaning product vehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.
Check that the braking system is operating correctly.
